snippet: The Orange County Legislature voted against providing funds to replace a controversial 1967 government building in Goshen, N.Y., designed by the celebrated Modernist architect Paul Rudolph.
abstract: Orange County Legislature votes against funding replacement of controversial County Government Center in Goshen, NY, leaving open the possibility that the aging structure could still be renovated; preservationists argue that building, designed in 1967 by celebrated architect Paul Rudolph, is a prime example of Modernism's Brutalist architecture. Photo (M)
lead_paragraph: A controversial government building designed by the celebrated Modernist architect Paul Rudolph in Goshen, N.Y., has been rescued from the bulldozers -- at least temporarily. The Orange County Legislature voted 11 to 10 on Thursday night not to provide the necessary financing to replace the blocky concrete government center, built in 1967.
